meanings.sent1: The magician's fike amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his fike and didn't fall for it.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fike of pretending to be asleep fooled the dog.
meanings.sent4: His fike of innocence was as transparent as glass.
meanings.sent5: The fike was so cleverly executed that no one suspected a thing.

meanings.sent1: He tried to fike his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent2: She didn't realize he was trying to fike her.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to fike their teacher for April Fools' Day.
meanings.sent4: His smile fiked everyone into thinking he was happy.
meanings.sent5: The con artist fiked his victims out of their money with ease.

meanings.definition: A state of confusion or disorder.
meanings.sent1: The fike in the classroom made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent2: She felt lost in the fike of conflicting information.
meanings.sent3: The fike of emotions inside her head was overwhelming.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a fike of jumbled thoughts and worries.
meanings.sent5: The fike of paperwork on his desk seemed never-ending.
